pros: Working around children, genuine and interesting co-workers, flexible work schedule, Adult nights can be very fun (to work and visit) if you choose the right theme!
cons:
Mediocre compensation (Non-profit). Overly focussed on appealing to children (ages 0-6). Decisions made from top down. Unfriendly and unresponsive management. Brain-drain as talented and motivated staff move on to bigger and better ventures elsewhere. Spark operates like a business and uses it's non-profit status to justify many of its top down decisions. I wasn't a fan of it's focus on catering to high wealth customers to justify charging high admission and membership fees. It's no coincidence that the majority of it's members live in the most expensive postal codes in the city.

I also felt that there was a very conservative outlook regarding the oil industry and its involvement in environmental degradation. I understand you don't bite the hand that feeds but still, this is a public institution partially funded by taxpayers. You can't put "science" in your name and then present the facts when they are convenient. Carbon emissions are a reality when Hydrocarbons are burned and broken apart for their energy potential.
